result.execSummary:
The defendant Catherine G Bucheger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation. To be paid before costs and fines.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions. Sign medical releases for agent.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

No Contact with any victims listed in the criminal complaint unless they consent and deemed appropriate by agent. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED to be used at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: 2 letters from His House/New Creation Intensive Outpatient program and an e-mail from program manager
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Catherine G Bucheger in court with Attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Bound over. Information filed.  Reading is waived.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS     **May terminate after 2 years if deemed appropriate by agent**  TRANSFER OF PROBATION ALLOWED TO STATE OF CALIFORNIA

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions/sign releases
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victims listed in criminal complaint unless they consent and deemed appropriate by agent
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $16,700.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - (to be used at agent's discretion)

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
 
**Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence**

Attorney Katie Beth Bricco in court.   Defendant Catherine G Bucheger did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco states that Defendant is in treatment in California.  State takes no position on next court date.  Court leaves plea and sentence date previously set to remain on.    Bail remains as fixed.
Plea hearing on September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Katie B Bricco in court.   Defendant Catherine G Bucheger did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in treatment out of state and defense counsel is requesting adjournment. Attorney Bricco stated that this matter will be a waiver and would like to go to disposition at the next court date.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel

Defendant to have no contact with the victims listed in the complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Catherine G Bucheger in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
